intro: Conostylis bromelioides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved conostylis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences that bear pale yellow or greenish flowers. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in coastal or inland regions. Conostylis bromelioides is often found in open habitats and is adapted to tolerate drought and salt spray.
